intro: Tephrosia vicioides var. inflexa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tephrosia, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and small, white to pale purple flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade. The species is noted for its potential use in traditional medicine and as a forage plant for livestock.
